alert.note: Alert for Boone; Fayette; Jackson; Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 7:53PM EDT until July 02 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Kanawha County in central West Virginia... Central Putnam County in western West Virginia... East central Lincoln County in central West Virginia... South central Jackson County in northwestern West Virginia... Northwestern Fayette County in southeastern West Virginia... Northeastern Boone County in central West Virginia... * Until 830 PM EDT. * At 752 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles west of Alum Creek, or 7 miles east of Hamlin, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Madison, Winfield, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Sissonville, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Cedar Grove, Poca, East Bank, Glasgow, Pratt, Pinch, Powellton and Institute. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 119. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 39 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 70 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 61 and 80. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Fayette; Jackson; Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam
